subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Possibly from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*pʷak||pig}}; cognate with {{cog|my|ဝက်}}, {{cog|bo|ཕག}} ({{zh-ref|Benedict, 1972}}; STEDT). 

However, {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} points out phonological mismatches:
* A medial ''*-r-'' in {{cog|och|-}} should correspond to a pre-initial in {{cog|tbq|-}}, but this is not present.
* A final ''*-k'' is present in {{cog|tbq|-}} yet absent in {{cog|och|-}} (uncommon correspondence).
He instead considers {{w|Waic language|Waic}} *'''bras''' as a better match, both phonologically and semantically.
